page.title: 01BUCKHORN WESTON
page.content: Buckhorn Weston is the only village in the area, lying in Dorset half a mile from the Somerset border.It lies on rising land overlooking marshy pasture to the west crossed by the river Cale and a section of the Waterloo to Exeter railway.Near the village is Templecombe railway station. Also nearby is an egg-shaped tunnel made from bricks from the old village brickworks now no longer in production although the family who owned it still lives locally.The village has all the amenities including a service station for motor vehicles. There are several farms which are mainly for beef and dairy cattle. Many of the once numerous footpaths linking these farms are now sisused.Marsh Court was once the Manor House of Wincanton and was linked to Stavordale Priory, the Augustinian Priory in nearby Charlton
